qas.question: How many continents did the torch visit?
What was the stop that was to happen between Ho Chi Minh City and Hong Kong?
The Republic of China felt that the wrong decision could place Taiwan on the same level as what two areas?
The torch route covered six what?
What government disagreed on the language used to describe the torch route?
What two places did Taiwan not want to be considered equal with in the language of the torch's route description?
How many kilometers was the torch supposed to go through Taiwan?

context: The route carried the torch through <a0_0>six<a0_0/> <a3_0>continents<a3_0/> from March 2008 to May 2008 to August 2008. The planned route originally included a stop in <a1_0>Taipei<a1_0/> between Ho Chi Minh City and Hong Kong, but there was disagreement in Beijing and Taipei over language used to describe whether it was an international or a domestic part of the route. While the Olympic committees of China and Chinese Taipei reached initial consensus on the approach, the government of the Republic of China in Taiwan intervened, stating that this placement could be interpreted as placing Taiwan on the same level as <a2_0><a5_0>Hong Kong and Macau<a5_0/><a2_0/>, an implication it objected to. The Beijing Organizing Committee attempted to continue negotiation, but further disputes arose over the flag or the anthem of the Republic of China along the <a6_0>24<a6_0/> km torch route in <a4_0>Taiwan.<a4_0/> By the midnight deadline for concluding the negotiation on September 21, 2007, Taiwan and China were unable to come to terms with the issue of the Torch Relay. In the end, both sides of the Taiwan Strait decided to eliminate the Taipei leg.
